channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says he will announce 25% steel and aluminum tariffs Monday
item.description: President Donald Trump said he will announce on Monday that the United States will impose 25% tariffs on all steel and aluminum imports, including fro...

item.title: Media Should Investigate Federal Waste Instead Of The People Uncovering It
item.description: As usual, the media are missing the target. They should follow the money, not the people uncovering the massive spending racket.

item.title: Trump says he is pulling security clearances for people he does not 'respect'

item.title: Beyond the Hype: Do Hedge Funds Deliver Value?
item.description: Skill and alpha are scarce and difficult to obtain in the hedge fund market.

item.title: Book Review: The Making of Modern Corporate Finance
item.description: Donald Chew delivers a love letter to unfettered capitalism and the financial system that oils the gears of commerce.

item.title: Watchdog To DOJ: Investigate Oregon For Destroying Voter Records

item.title: U.S. and China have hit each other with tit-for-tat tariffs for years. Here’s the history since Trump’s first term
item.description: The rapid-fire shots of tariffs and import curbs hearken back to Trump’s first term in office, when the U.S. and China engaged in a trade war.

item.title: Trump Signals He’ll Fight For Reality At UNICEF With Motion To Nuke DEI And Trans Ideology
item.description: Though the trans- and DEI-focused amendments failed to pass, they demonstrated that the Trump administration intends to fight on all fronts.

item.title: The ‘nice’ CEO is no longer en vogue as business pressures reshape leadership styles
item.description: CEOs like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg are adopting aspects of Jack Welch's high-intensity, performance-focused management style.

item.title: Democrats Have Become The ‘No You Can’t’ Party
item.description: In the battle between the 'you can just do things' and the 'you can't do thats,' whose side do you want to be on?

item.title: Rise of the Romantasy
item.description: Young adults are reading more because they’re reading books that are easy to love.

item.title: When a Harvard MBA No Longer Guarantees a Job, Seek a Different Sort of Education
item.description: Perhaps the purpose of higher education, at least initially, shouldn’t be to pass on a fixed set of job skills, but to form the intellect.

item.title: Did Real Assets Provide an Inflation Hedge When Investors Needed it Most?

item.title: Some Fortune 500 CEO’s in Europe secretly envy Trumpism—is it time to cut the red tape?
item.description: Some European business leaders are asking the question, is it possible to make a similar move towards deregulation as in the U.S.?

item.title: Up next? Steel tariffs: Trump continues early-term blitz over Super Bowl weekend
item.description: President Trump announced Sunday he plans to slap a 25% tariff on steel and aluminum imports, marking his latest move to reshape global trade.

item.title: Stand Athwart the Progressive Leviathan
item.description: Hostility to the excesses of the federal government is a possible source of consensus on the right.

item.title: USAID Funneled Nearly $800 Million To ‘Gender Transformative’ Global Censorship Group
item.description: USAID funneled $799 million to a group that launched a global censorship platform and pushed radical gender ideology.
